121.description: Warning threshold for network Interface avg. Bytes Received/sec is the average of incoming Bytes.
121.caption: IncomingAvgBandUsageWarn

31.description:
String that expects input format like "20d", which translates to 20 days. Allowed units: ms, s, m, h, d, w, M, y.

Thereby all files which have a change date older then 20 days are considered within the check.
31.caption: ChangeOlderThan

117.description:
Warning threshold for network Interface Packets Received Discarded is the number of inbound packets that were chosen to be discarded
even though no errors had been detected to prevent their delivery to a higher-layer protocol.
117.caption: PacketReceivedDiscardedWarn

59.description: Warning threshold for Avg. Disk sec/Write is the average time, in seconds, of a write of data to the disk. If the threshold values are not in seconds, please enter a unit such as (ms, s, m, h, ...)
59.caption: DiskAvgWriteSecWarning

5.description:
Used to specify a Critical range for the end date of an certificate. In this case a string.
Allowed units include: ms, s, m, h, d, w, M, y
5.caption: CriticalEnd

53.description: Warning threshold for disk Write Bytes/sec is rate at which bytes are transferred to the disk during write operations.
53.caption: DiskWriteByteSecWarning

47.description:
Warning threshold for current Disk Queue Length is the number of requests outstanding on the disk at the time the performance data is collected.
It also includes requests in service at the time of the collection. This is a instantaneous snapshot, not an average over the
time interval. Multi-spindle disk devices can have multiple requests that are active at one time, but other concurrent requests
are awaiting service. This counter might reflect a transitory high or low queue length, but if there is a sustained load on the
disk drive, it is likely that this will be consistently high. Requests experience delays proportional to the length of this queue
minus the number of spindles on the disks. For good performance, this difference should average less than two.
47.caption: DiskQueueLenWarning

100.description:
Used to specify a Warning threshold. In this case an string value.
The string has to be like, "20B", "20KB", "20MB", "20GB", "20TB", "20PB"
This is using the default Icinga threshold handling.
100.caption: Warning

78.description: Used to specify an array of message sources within the eventlog to be excluded.
78.caption: ExcludeSource

169.description: Used to specify a offset Warning threshold e.g 10ms or 0.01s
169.caption: Warning

170.description: Used to specify a offset Critical threshold e.g 20ms or 0.02s.
170.caption: Critical

89.description: Treshold on which the plugin will return 'CRITICAL' for the response time in ms
89.caption: Critical

108.description: Specify the name of network interface teams you want to include for checks. Example OutboundGroup, ClusterInterface
108.caption: IncludeInterfaceTeam

39.description: Specify the index id of disks you want to include for checks. Example 0, 1
39.caption: IncludeDisk

110.description: Critical threshold for network Interface Packets Received/sec is the rate at which packets are received on the network interface.
110.caption: PacketReceivedSecCrit

51.description: Warning threshold for disk Read Bytes/sec is the rate at which bytes are transferred from the disk during read operations.
51.caption: DiskReadByteSecWarning

191.description: Allows to set Unknown partitions to Ok in case no metrics could be loaded.
191.caption: SkipUnknown

144.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
144.caption: Verbosity

189.description:
Overrides the default behaviour of the plugin in case no check element is left for being checked (if all elements are filtered out for example).
Instead of returning `Unknown` the plugin will return `Ok` instead if this argument is set.
189.caption: IgnoreEmptyChecks

72.description: Used to specify an array of usernames within the eventlog to be excluded.
72.caption: ExcludeUsername

158.description:
A list of tasks to check for. If your tasks contain spaces, wrap them around a ' to ensure they are
properly handled as string
158.caption: TaskName

45.description: Warning theeshold for disk Writes/sec is the rate of write operations on the disk.
45.caption: DiskWriteSecWarning

49.description: Warning threshold for Avg. Disk Queue Length is the average number of both read and write requests that were queued for the selected disk during the sample interval.
49.caption: DiskQueueAvgLenWarning

116.description:
Critical threshold for network Interface Packets Outbound Errors is the number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted
because of errors.
116.caption: PackteOutboundErrorCrit

81.description:
Switch to disable the time cache on a check. If this parameter is set the time cache is disabled.
After the check has been run once, the next check instance will filter through the eventlog from the point the last check ended.
This is due to the time cache, when disabled the whole eventlog is checked instead.
81.caption: DisableTimeCache

125.description:
Warning threshold for network Interface Bytes Total/sec is the rate at which bytes are sent and received over each network adapter,
including framing characters.
125.caption: DeviceTotalBytesSecWarn

113.description:
Warning threshold for network Interface Packets Received Errors is the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing
them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.
113.caption: PackteReceivedErrorWarn

3.description:
Used to specify a date. The start date of the certificate has to be past the date specified, otherwise the check results in critical. Use carefully.
Use format like: 'yyyy-MM-dd'
3.caption: CriticalStart

75.description: Used to specify an array of messages within the eventlog to be included.
75.caption: IncludeMessage

153.description: Used to specify a Warning threshold. In this case an integer value.
153.caption: Warning

94.description: The size of each packet send to the target host
94.caption: PacketSize

101.description:
Used to specify a Critical threshold for the memory usage in percent, like 30 for 30%.
This is using the default Icinga threshold handling.
101.caption: CriticalPercent

85.description:
Used to specify whether the firewall profiles should be enabled or disabled.

-Enabled $TRUE
translates to enabled, while
not being specified
translates to disabled.
85.caption: Enabled

114.description:
Critical threshold for network Interface Packets Received Errors is the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing
them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.
114.caption: PackteReceivedErrorCrit

21.description: Used to specify a single core to check for. For the average load across all cores use `_Total`
21.caption: Core

24.description:
Used to specify a path.
e.g. 'C:\Users\Icinga\Downloads'
24.caption: Path

52.description: Critical threshold for disk Read Bytes/sec is the rate at which bytes are transferred from the disk during read operations.
52.caption: DiskReadByteSecCritical

163.description:
Allows to exclude services which might come in handy for checking services which are configured to start automatically
on Windows but are not running and weren't exited properly.
163.caption: Exclude

43.description: Warning threshold for disk Reads/sec is the rate of read operations on the disk.
43.caption: DiskReadSecWarning

145.description: Used to specify the profile to check. Available profiles are 'DomainAuthenticated', 'Public', 'Private'
145.caption: Profile

154.description: Used to specify a Critical threshold. In this case an integer value.
154.caption: Critical

168.description:
The maximum acceptable offset between the local clock and the NTP Server, in seconds e.g. if you allow up to 0.5s timeoffset you can also enter 500ms.
Invoke-IcingaCheckTimeSync will return OK, if there is no difference between them,
WARNING, if the time difference exceeds the Warning threshold,
CRITICAL, if the time difference exceeds the Critical threshold.
168.caption: TimeOffset

32.description:
String that expects input format like "20d", which translates to 20 days. Allowed units: ms, s, m, h, d, w, M, y.

Thereby all files which have been created 20 days ago are considered within the check.
32.caption: CreationTimeEqual

20.description: Used to specify a Critical threshold. In this case an integer value.
20.caption: Critical

73.description: Used to specify an array of entry types within the eventlog to be included.
73.caption: IncludeEntryType

133.description: Warning threshold for the Status of a network Interface Teams.
133.caption: IfTeamStatusWarn

8.description: Used to specify an array of Subjects, which are used to determine what certificate to check, within the CertStore.
8.caption: CertSubject

29.description:
String that expects input format like "20d", which translates to 20 days. Allowed units: ms, s, m, h, d, w, M, y.

Thereby all files which have been changed 20 days ago are considered within the check.
29.caption: ChangeTimeEqual

2.description:
Used to switch on trusted behavior. Whether to check, If the certificate is trusted by the system root.
Will return Critical in case of untrust.

Note: it is currently required that the root and intermediate CA is known and trusted by the local system.
2.caption: Trusted

62.description: Ignores any disk which is having the state `Read Only` and returns `Ok` instead of `Warning` for this specific state
62.caption: IgnoreReadOnlyDisks

33.description:
String that expects input format like "20d", which translates to 20 days. Allowed units: ms, s, m, h, d, w, M, y.

Thereby all files which have a creation date older then 20 days are considered within the check.
33.caption: CreationOlderThan

193.description:
Used to specify an array of usernames to match against.

e.g 'Administrator', 'Icinga'
193.caption: Username

84.description: Used to specify an array of profiles to check. Available profiles are 'Domain', 'Public', 'Private'
84.caption: Profile

107.description: Specify the name of network interface teams you want to exclude for checks. Example OutboundGroup, ClusterInterface
107.caption: ExcludeInterfaceTeam

58.description: Critical threshold for avg. Disk sec/Read is the average time, in seconds, of a read of data from the disk. If the threshold values are not in seconds, please enter a unit such as (ms, s, m, h, ...)
58.caption: DiskAvgReadSecCritical

139.description: Critical threshold for the current network interface operational status.
139.caption: IfOperationalStatusCrit

192.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
192.caption: Verbosity

112.description: Critical threshold for network Interface Packets Sent/sec is the rate at which packets are sent on the network interface.
112.caption: PacketSentSecCrit

48.description:
Critical threshold for current Disk Queue Length is the number of requests outstanding on the disk at the time the performance data is collected.
It also includes requests in service at the time of the collection. This is a instantaneous snapshot, not an average over the
time interval. Multi-spindle disk devices can have multiple requests that are active at one time, but other concurrent requests
are awaiting service. This counter might reflect a transitory high or low queue length, but if there is a sustained load on the
disk drive, it is likely that this will be consistently high. Requests experience delays proportional to the length of this queue
minus the number of spindles on the disks. For good performance, this difference should average less than two.
48.caption: DiskQueueLenCritical

195.description: Used to specify a Critical threshold. In this case an integer value.
195.caption: Critical

177.description: Used to specify a Warning threshold. In this case an integer value.
177.caption: Warning

190.description: Disables the performance data output of this plugin
190.caption: NoPerfData

42.description: Specify the partition drive letters for disks to exclude from checks. Example C:, D:
42.caption: ExcludePartition

130.description:
Critical threshold for network Interface Bytes Received/sec is the rate at which bytes are received over each network adapter, including
framing characters.
130.caption: DeviceReceivedBytesSecCrit

35.description:
String that expects input format like "20MB", which translates to the filze size 20 MB. Allowed units: B, KB, MB, GB, TB.

Thereby all files with a size of 20 MB or larger are considered within the check.
35.caption: FileSizeGreaterThan

60.description: Critical threshold for Avg. Disk sec/Write is the average time, in seconds, of a write of data to the disk. If the threshold values are not in seconds, please enter a unit such as (ms, s, m, h, ...)
60.caption: DiskAvgWriteSecCritical

115.description:
Warning threshold for network Interface Packets Outbound Errors is the number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted

115.caption: PackteOutboundErrorWarn

34.description:

34.caption: CreationYoungerThan

132.description: Critical threshold for the transmit link speed in (10 MBit, 100 MBit, 1 GBit, 10 GBit, 100 GBit, ...) of the network Interface.
132.caption: LinkSpeedCrit

162.description:
Used to specify an array of services which should be checked against the status. Supports '*' for
wildcards.
162.caption: Service

28.description: Used to specify a Warning threshold. Follows the Icinga plugin threshold
28.caption: Warning

76.description: Used to specify an array of messages within the eventlog to be excluded.
76.caption: ExcludeMessage

166.description: Disables the performance data output of this plugin
166.caption: NoPerfData

167.description: The NTP Server you want to connect to.

155.description:
Used to specify an array of processes to count and match against.
e.g. conhost,wininit
155.caption: Process

50.description: Critical threshold for Avg. Disk Queue Length is the average number of both read and write requests that were queued for the selected disk during the sample interval.
50.caption: DiskQueueAvgLenCritical

188.description:
Used to specify an array of partitions to be excluded.
e.g. 'C:\','D:\'
188.caption: Exclude

106.description: Specify the index of network adapters you want to exclude for checks. Example 4, 3
106.caption: ExcludeNetworkDevice

80.description: Used to specify a date like dd.mm.yyyy and every eventlog entry before that date will be considered.
80.caption: Before

19.description: Used to specify a Warning threshold. In this case an integer value.
19.caption: Warning

10.description: Used to specify an array of paths on your system, where certificate files are. Use with CertName.

9.description: Used to specify which path within the CertStore should be checked.

134.description: Critical threshold for the Status of a network Interface Teams.
134.caption: IfTeamStatusCrit

57.description: Warning threshold for avg. Disk sec/Read is the average time, in seconds, of a read of data from the disk. If the threshold values are not in seconds, please enter a unit such as (ms, s, m, h, ...)
57.caption: DiskAvgReadSecWarning

142.description:
Set this argument if you want to include hidden network Adapter for checks. It is a network which is available but is not

165.description:

Used to specify a Critical threshold. In this case a string.

56.description: Critical threshold for avg. Disk sec/Transfer is the time, in seconds, of the average disk transfer. If the threshold values are not in seconds, please enter a unit such as (ms, s, m, h, ...)
56.caption: DiskAvgTransSecCritical

150.description: Used to specify a Critical threshold. In this case an ??? value.

71.description: Used to specify an array of usernames within the eventlog to be included.

11.description: Used to specify an array of certificate names of certificate files to check. Use with CertPaths.

e.g. 'C:\','D:\'

25.description:

e.g '*.txt', '*.sql' # Fiends all files ending with .txt and .sql
25.caption: FileNames

102.description:
Used to specify a Warning threshold for the memory usage in percent, like 30 for 30%.
This is using the default Icinga threshold handling.
102.caption: WarningPercent

136.description: Critical threshold for the State of a network Interface Team-Members/Slaves.
136.caption: IfSlaveEnabledStateCrit

55.description: Warning threshold for avg. Disk sec/Transfer is the time, in seconds, of the average disk transfer. If the threshold values are not in seconds, please enter a unit such as (ms, s, m, h, ...)
55.caption: DiskAvgTransSecWarning

131.description: Warning threshold for the transmit link speed in (10 MBit, 100 MBit, 1 GBit, 10 GBit, 100 GBit, ...) of the network Interface.
131.caption: LinkSpeedWarn

44.description: Critical treshold for disk Reads/sec is the rate of read operations on the disk.
44.caption: DiskReadSecCritical

109.description: Warning threshold for network Interface Packets Received/sec is the rate at which packets are received on the network interface.
109.caption: PacketReceivedSecWarn

61.description: Ignores any disk which is having the state `Offline` and returns `Ok` instead of `Warning` for this specific state
61.caption: IgnoreOfflineDisks

15.description:
Used to specify a string, which contains the algorithm to be used.

Allowed algorithms: 'SHA1', 'SHA256', 'SHA384', 'SHA512', 'MD5'
15.caption: Algorithm

140.description: Warning threshold for the state of the network adapter connection to the network.
140.caption: IfConnectionStatusWarn

186.description: Used to specify a Critical threshold. In this case an integer value.
186.caption: Critical

26.description: A switch, which can be set to search through directories recursively.
26.caption: Recurse

138.description: Warning threshold for the current network interface operational status.
138.caption: IfOperationalStatusWarn

36.description:
String that expects input format like "5MB", which translates to the filze size 5 MB. Allowed units: B, KB, MB, GB, TB.

Thereby all files with a size of 5 MB or less are considered within the check.
36.caption: FileSizeSmallerThan

160.description: Set this argument to not write any performance data
160.caption: NoPerfData

7.description: Used to specify an array of Thumbprints, which are used to determine what certificate to check, within the CertStore.
7.caption: CertThumbprint

63.description: Set this to include only disks that have drive letters like C:, D:, ..., assigned to them. Can be combined with include/exclude filters
63.caption: CheckLogicalOnly

124.description: Critical threshold for network Interface avg. Bytes Sent/sec is the average of outbound Bytes.
124.caption: OutboundAvgBandUsageCrit

148.description: Used to specify an array of performance counter to check against.
148.caption: PerfCounter

159.description: The state a task should currently have for the plugin to return [OK]
159.caption: State

95.description: Force the usage of IPv4 addresses for ICMP calls by using a hostname
95.caption: IPv4
